verses.kjv: And when Athaliah the mother of Ahaziah saw that her son was dead, she arose and destroyed all the seed royal.
verses.ct: When Athaliah, the mother of Ahaziah, learned that her son was dead, she took action and killed all the royal descendants.

verses.kjv: But Jehosheba, the daughter of king Joram, sister of Ahaziah, took Joash the son of Ahaziah, and stole him from among the king’s sons which were slain; and they hid him, even him and his nurse, in the bedchamber from Athaliah, so that he was not slain.
verses.ct: But Jehosheba, the daughter of King Joram and sister of Ahaziah, rescued Joash son of Ahaziah by secretly taking him away from the other princes who were being murdered. She hid him and his nurse in a bedroom, keeping him out of Athaliah's reach so that he was not killed.

verses.kjv: And he was with her hid in the house of the LORD six years. And Athaliah did reign over the land.
verses.ct: He remained hidden with her in the house of the LORD for 6 years while Athaliah ruled the land.

verses.kjv: And the seventh year Jehoiada sent and fetched the rulers over hundreds, with the captains and the guard, and brought them to him into the house of the LORD, and made a covenant with them, and took an oath of them in the house of the LORD, and shewed them the king’s son.
verses.ct: In the 7th year, Jehoiada sent for the commanders of units of 100, along with the officers and the royal guards. He brought them to the house of the LORD, made a covenant with them, and had them swear an oath there in the house of the LORD. Then he showed them the king's son.

verses.kjv: And he commanded them, saying, This is the thing that ye shall do; A third part of you that enter in on the sabbath shall even be keepers of the watch of the king’s house;
verses.ct: He gave them these orders: "Here is what you are to do. A 3rd of you who come on duty on the Sabbath will guard the royal palace.

verses.kjv: And a third part shall be at the gate of Sur; and a third part at the gate behind the guard: so shall ye keep the watch of the house, that it be not broken down.
verses.ct: Another 3rd will be stationed at the Sur Gate, and the remaining 3rd will be at the gate behind the guards. You will take turns guarding the temple so that no one breaks through.

verses.kjv: And two parts of all you that go forth on the sabbath, even they shall keep the watch of the house of the LORD about the king.
verses.ct: The 2 divisions of you who are going off duty on the Sabbath will stand guard at the house of the LORD to protect the king.

verses.kjv: And ye shall compass the king round about, every man with his weapons in his hand: and he that cometh within the ranges, let him be slain: and be ye with the king as he goeth out and as he cometh in.
verses.ct: Surround the king on every side, each man with his weapon ready. Anyone who tries to break through your ranks must be killed. Stay with the king wherever he goes."

verses.kjv: And the captains over the hundreds did according to all things that Jehoiada the priest commanded: and they took every man his men that were to come in on the sabbath, with them that should go out on the sabbath, and came to Jehoiada the priest.
verses.ct: The commanders of the units of 100 carried out everything that Jehoiada the priest ordered. Each one gathered his men — both those coming on duty for the Sabbath and those going off duty — and reported to Jehoiada the priest.

verses.kjv: And to the captains over hundreds did the priest give king David’s spears and shields, that were in the temple of the LORD.
verses.ct: The priest distributed to the commanders the spears and shields that had belonged to King David, which were stored in the temple of the LORD.

verses.kjv: And the guard stood, every man with his weapons in his hand, round about the king, from the right corner of the temple to the left corner of the temple, along by the altar and the temple.
verses.ct: The guards took their positions, each man armed, forming a line from the south side of the temple to the north side, surrounding the altar and the temple to protect the king.

verses.kjv: And he brought forth the king’s son, and put the crown upon him, and gave him the testimony; and they made him king, and anointed him; and they clapped their hands, and said, God save the king.
verses.ct: Then Jehoiada brought out the king's son, placed the crown on his head, and presented him with the written covenant. They proclaimed him king and anointed him. The people clapped and shouted, "Long live the king!"

verses.kjv: And when Athaliah heard the noise of the guard and of the people, she came to the people into the temple of the LORD.
verses.ct: When Athaliah heard the commotion from the guards and the crowd, she rushed to the people at the temple of the LORD.

verses.kjv: And when she looked, behold, the king stood by a pillar, as the manner was, and the princes and the trumpeters by the king, and all the people of the land rejoiced, and blew with trumpets: and Athaliah rent her clothes, and cried, Treason, Treason.
verses.ct: She looked and saw the king standing by the pillar, as was the custom, with the officials and trumpet players beside him. All the people of the land were celebrating and blowing trumpets. Athaliah tore her clothes in grief and screamed, "Treason! Treason!"

verses.kjv: But Jehoiada the priest commanded the captains of the hundreds, the officers of the host, and said unto them, Have her forth without the ranges: and him that followeth her kill with the sword. For the priest had said, Let her not be slain in the house of the LORD.
verses.ct: Jehoiada the priest ordered the commanders of the units of 100, the military officers, and told them, "Escort her out through the ranks, and kill with the sword anyone who follows her." The priest had specifically said, "She must not be killed inside the house of the LORD."

verses.kjv: And they laid hands on her; and she went by the way by the which the horses came into the king’s house: and there was she slain.
verses.ct: So they seized her and took her through the entrance where horses enter the palace grounds, and there she was killed.

verses.kjv: And Jehoiada made a covenant between the LORD and the king and the people, that they should be the LORD’s people; between the king also and the people.
verses.ct: Then Jehoiada established a covenant between the LORD, the king, and the people, committing them to be the LORD's people. He also made a covenant between the king and the people.

verses.kjv: And all the people of the land went into the house of Baal, and brake it down; his altars and his images brake they in pieces thoroughly, and slew Mattan the priest of Baal before the altars. And the priest appointed officers over the house of the LORD.
verses.ct: All the people of the land went to the temple of Baal and tore it down. They completely smashed its altars and idols, and they killed Mattan, the priest of Baal, right in front of the altars. Jehoiada the priest then assigned guards to oversee the house of the LORD.

verses.kjv: And he took the rulers over hundreds, and the captains, and the guard, and all the people of the land; and they brought down the king from the house of the LORD, and came by the way of the gate of the guard to the king’s house. And he sat on the throne of the kings.
verses.ct: He assembled the commanders of the units of 100, the officers, the guards, and all the people of the land. Together they escorted the king down from the house of the LORD, going through the guards' gate into the royal palace. There the king took his seat on the royal throne.

verses.kjv: And all the people of the land rejoiced, and the city was in quiet: and they slew Athaliah with the sword beside the king’s house.
verses.ct: All the people of the land celebrated, and the city was peaceful. As for Athaliah, they had killed her with the sword at the palace.

verses.kjv: Seven years old was Jehoash when he began to reign.
verses.ct: Jehoash was 7 years old when he became king.
